title: 11 Books to Read: The Best Reviews of August
sub_head: ‘The Director,’ ‘How the Mountains Grew,’ ‘Four Thousand Weeks’ and more of the books our reviewers highlighted this month.
body:
A selection of the month’s most noteworthy books, as discussed by The Wall Street Journal’s reviewers.
By Rebecca Donner | Little, Brown
Moira Hodgson calls the true story of Mildred Harnack’s heroic work against the Nazi regime a “nonfiction narrative with the pace of a political thriller,” tracing the brave acts and unheard warnings of the American-born resister. “Ms. Donner evocatively brings to life the giddy feeling of freedom under the Weimar regime in Berlin and how swiftly it eroded,” Ms. Hodgson writes. ”This is a powerful book.”
